intro: Psacalium paucicapitatum, commonly known as the small-headed psacalium, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its small, clustered flowers that are typically pink or white in color. Its leaves are ovate and covered in fine hairs, and it produces capsule fruits that contain numerous tiny seeds. Psacalium paucicapitatum is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forests and stream banks.
